Messages.Author: Naveed Ali Khan Kaim Khani
Messages.Content: Hello everyone,  I apologize for any inconvenience, but I'd like to clarify that the 7th of July falls on a Sunday. I mistakenly confused it with the 7th of June. Since Sunday is a holiday and many of us have planned activities, I suggest rescheduling the ORAL EXAM to the 11th of July during the scheduled lecture time slot of 4-5 PM.  BR  Naveed

Messages.Author: Naveed Ali Khan Kaim Khani
Messages.Content: HI Everyone,   Tomorrow lecture is postponed. I have uploaded 4th worksheet. if is there any issue please contact me by email.   Oral exam will be conducted on 7th July 2024.   BR Naveed

Messages.Author: Jonas Krause
Messages.Content: Hello Naveed,  you said in the Announcements "Oral exam will be conducted on 7th July 2024. ". It is in 10 days on a sunday.  The lecture slides say that the oral exam is on 25.07.2024. Could you please clarify as soon as possible when exactly the exam is.  Thank you Jonas

Messages.Author: Naveed Ali Khan Kaim Khani
Messages.Content: Yes, as per last time discussion, there were two dates 7th and 1th July, i decided on 7th July because it help me to summarized the final marks before my holidays  If you guys have any difficulties, please let me , we can sort-out it , I will change the dates according your comfort.  Thank you  Naveed

Messages.Author: Joao Victor Pacheco Sobral
Messages.Content: Hello Naveed,  I will be traveling 7th July, which is a Sunday, are you sure the exam will be held on a Sunday? If so, will there be a second exam date?  Thanks.

Messages.Author: Jacopo Ceravolo
Messages.Content: Hi everyone, is anyone able to find the file "northcap.png" as specified in worksheet 2? I'm only able to see "lena.png" and "landscape.png" in the assignment folder. Is it a typo and we're supposed to work on the file "landscape.png"?

Messages.Author: Adam Adam
Messages.Content: Hi Jacopo,  just like you, we are unable to find the "northcap.png". And since there is no other image besides "landscape.png", we decided to use it as "northcap.png".  Best Adam

Messages.Author: Florentine Jutta Seuffert
Messages.Content: Hi,  I have a question regarding WS1 Question 1.  First I implemented the calculation of skewness like described in this article:  https://www.datacamp.com/tutorial/understanding-skewness-and-kurtosis But Wikipedia tells to calculate the skewness like this: https://de.wikipedia.org/wiki/Moment_(Stochastik)#Zentrale_Momente    As both approaches get me different solution I was wondering which one to take and I couldn't tell from the slides.  Happy about answers :)  Thank you and best regards,  Florentine

Messages.Author: Joao Victor Pacheco Sobral
Messages.Content: Hi Flo,  I could only find the second definition when searching, I'm not sure about the first one you linked.  I found this paper (https://www.sciencedirect.com/science/article/pii/S1544612303000035) that shows the same definition from Wikipedia, I hope this helps.  From my understanding the skewness value should be reflected in your distribution graph, so if it is a positive value, you have a distribution more inclined to the left, if it's negative it should be more inclined to the right and vice versa.

Messages.Content: dear all, i am sick so i cannot participate today. I hope it will still be possible to join a group for homework assignments next week.  best, Flo
